PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Reader package

Submodules

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Reader.Excel module

class PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Reader.Excel.ExcelReader(file: str | BytesIO | bytes, engine: str = '', fmt: str = '')

Bases: object

A class for reading Excel files, supporting multiple engines and formats.

Parameters:

  • file – The path to the file or a file-like object.

  • engine – The name of the engine to use for reading. If not specified, it is auto-detected based on the file format.

  • fmt – The format of the file (e.g., ‘xls’, ‘xlsx’). If not specified, it is inferred from the file name.

nsheets()

Return the number of sheets in the workbook.

Returns:

The number of sheets.

Return type:

int

sheet_by_index(idx: int) → Sheet

Return a Sheet object for the sheet at the given index.

Parameters:

idx – The index of the sheet (0-based).

Returns:

A Sheet object corresponding to the sheet at the given index.

Return type:

Sheet

Raises:

IndexError – If the index is out of range.

sheet_by_name(name: str) → Sheet

Return a Sheet object for the sheet with the given name.

Parameters:

name – The name of the sheet.

Returns:

A Sheet object corresponding to the sheet with the given name.

Return type:

Sheet

Raises:

KeyError – If no sheet with the given name exists.

sheet_names()

Return a list of all sheet names in the workbook.

Returns:

A list of sheet names.

Return type:

list[str]

sheets()

Return a list of Sheet objects for all sheets in the workbook.

Returns:

A list of Sheet objects.

Return type:

list[Sheet]

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Reader.Excel.add_reader(engine: Type[BaseReader])

Registers a new reader engine.

Parameters:

engine – The engine class to be registered, which must be a subclass of ReadBook.

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Reader.Excel.auto_engine(fmt: str)

Determines the appropriate engine to use based on the file format.

Parameters:

fmt – The format of the file (e.g., ‘xls’, ‘xlsx’).

Returns:

The name of the engine to use (‘xlrd’ for ‘xls’ files, ‘openpyxl’ for ‘xlsx’ files).

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Reader.Excel.install_builtin_readers()

Registers all built-in reader engines found in the Readers module. This function searches for subclasses of ReadBook in the Readers module

and registers them using their __engine__ attribute.

PyAutoExcel.Documents.File.Excel.Reader.Excel.remove_reader(name: str)

Removes a reader engine from the registry by name.

Parameters:

name – The name of the engine to be removed.
